title: The Best Way To Get Your Kids To Eat Their Vegetables
summary: Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat. Kids also dislike vegetables because they arenâ€™t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. Add Spirulina and Chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. Add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Why Kids Don\u2019t Like Veggies"),mdx("p",null,`Kids are not born disliking vegetables. In fact, they are born loving them. It\u2019s only after years of hearing \u201Ceat your veggies\u201D that they start to resent eating them. This happens for a few reasons. Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat them.
Kids also dislike vegetables because they aren\u2019t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. You can\u2019t just feed them raw broccoli and expect them to love it. They need to be presented in a way that gets them excited about eating them. This means finding ways to prepare vegetables that are both tasty and enjoyable for them to eat.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to Make a Green Smoothie for Your Kid"),mdx("p",null,"Once you\u2019ve chosen which ingredients you want to put into your green smoothie, the next step is to blend them up. If you have a blender with a large capacity, use it, but keep in mind that you may need to chop up some of your ingredients if they\u2019re too big. If you have a smaller blender, use a food processor or hand blender."),mdx("p",null,"Once your smoothie is blended, pour it into a bowl and add in any toppings you want like crumbled cookies, granola, nuts, seeds, dried fruit or coconut flakes. This will give your smoothie a fun appearance that kids will want to eat."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Spirulina and Chlorella"),mdx("p",null,"Spirulina and chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. These algae also contain protein, which makes them a great addition to a green smoothie that kids will want to drink."),mdx("p",null,"If a smoothie isn\u2019t appealing to your child, adding a scoop of spirulina or chlorella powder to their favourite food is another way to add this veggie boost to their diet. You can add it to oatmeal, yogurt, smoothies, pancakes, muffins, cookies and more."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Fruit"),mdx("p",null,"Fruits like berries, apples, oranges, mangoes and bananas are loaded with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These delicious fruits are the perfect way to get your kids excited about eating their vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"If you add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. This turns your smoothie into a purple smoothie that kids may not want to drink. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the bottom of your smoothie, your drink will be green. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend it until it\u2019s liquefied so it doesn\u2019t leave chunks at the top of the glass."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Dark Leafy Greens"),mdx("p",null,"Kale, spinach, Swiss chard and other dark leafy greens are packed with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These are the perfect ingredients to add to a green smoothie that will help kids get all the nutrients they need without even knowing it."),mdx("p",null,"If you choose to add these greens to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied so there are no chunks left behind. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender so they don\u2019t get blended up."),mdx("h2",null,"Adding Hidden Veggies: Broccoli, Spinach, Beets and more."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to give your kids a nutritious boost but don\u2019t want them to know they\u2019re drinking their veggies, here are some good ingredients to add to your green smoothie: broccoli, spinach, radishes, beets, carrots and bell peppers."),mdx("p",null,"These veggies blend up well in a green smoothie and you won\u2019t be able to taste them. If you\u2019re adding them to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied and they don\u2019t leave behind any chunks. If you want your smoothie to look green, add these ingredients to the bottom of the blender."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Creating the perfect green smoothie for your kid isn\u2019t difficult if you know what to put in it. The trick is to put nutritious ingredients into a drink that kids will love. This will get them excited about drinking their veggies, which will help them get the nutrients they need."),mdx("p",null,"Kids these days want sugar and flavour in everything they eat. If you can find a way to sneak nutrients into their favourite drinks and foods, you\u2019ll be doing them a favour and helping them grow up to be healthy adults."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating a Part of Your Lifestyle

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You probably know that eating a healthy diet is important. After all, five out of the top 10 causes of death in America are linked to unhealthy eating habits. However, it\u2019s not always easy to eat healthy. Work, school, family obligations and other commitments often make it challenging to follow a healthy diet on a daily basis. Fortunately, there are ways to make healthy eating a part of your lifestyle instead of an awkward obligation once a week or so.
And while we all have our moments when we crave junk food or a big greasy meal after a stressful day, making healthy eating a part of your everyday life can have profound benefits. A balanced diet filled with lots of fruits and vegetables lowers risk for almost every disease and helps you feel better mentally and physically. Follow these tips to help you integrate healthy eating into your daily routine as seamlessly as possible.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet
Top Health Benefits of Meditation and How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Meditation is one of the most effective ways to bring your mind and body back into balance. This ancient practice has been proven to help decrease stress, anxiety and depression, while also improving memory and concentration. In addition to these benefits, research shows that meditation can also have a positive impact on your immune system, blood pressure and heart health by lowering your levels of the stress hormone cortisol and lifting your levels of oxytocin (a \u201Clove hormone\u201D).
In this article, we take a look at some of the top health benefits of meditation and how you can get started today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthier Choices When Eating Out

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re watching what you eat for whatever reason, eating out can be a challenge. Many popular fast food and casual dining establishments now offer more healthful menu selections as a response to changing tastes among customers and nutrition-conscious consumers. However, these healthier options are not necessarily the best choices when you\u2019re trying to keep your calorie intake in check.
Eatting out at restaurants, cafes, fast food chains, or any other eatery requires some advance planning if you want to keep your diet in check. The primary considerations involve choosing places that offer healthy menu offerings as well as ordering smartly once you get there. This article will assist you in making wiser decisions the next time you eat out by identifying the pitfalls of most eating establishments and providing tips on how to navigate them with less of an impact on your waistline.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Plant-Based Foods for Optimal Health
How to Cook Healthier Meals at Home

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Getting a healthy meal at home can be challenging, especially with busy schedules and tight budgets. But you don\u2019t have to sacrifice your health to save money or reduce time spent in the kitchen.
A nutritious diet doesn\u2019t have to be expensive or time-consuming. With some planning and preparation, you can make home-cooked meals that are both cheap and healthy. Healthy eating is more than just counting calories; it\u2019s about focusing on foods that are unprocessed and rich in vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Eating well helps keep you lean, boost your immune system, manage your weight, and prevent chronic diseases like heart disease and type 2 diabetes. Focusing on the right foods will help get you there. Let\u2019s take a look at some tips on how to cook healthier meals at home!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Stick to Your Healthy Eating Goals

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The New Year brings new resolutions and the challenge to stick to them. But how can you make sure you succeed this time? Planning and preparation are key to any endeavor, including sticking to your healthy eating goals in the New Year. Thinking ahead and making a plan will help you avoid pitfalls and stay on track. After all, it\u2019s not about failing once but rather keeping failure at bay so it doesn\u2019t creep up again next year.
Many people struggle with their eating habits because they lack structure or fail to plan ahead. That\u2019s why creating a strategy is essential if you want to maintain this commitment for good. Whether it\u2019s going on a diet, cutting out certain foods or reducing your intake of fats, proteins or carbs \u2013 there are different ways how you can achieve your goals. Here are some helpful tips:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
